Question: When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: How close may you park your vehicle to an intersection where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What does this sign mean?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen
There is broken glass on the road

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: When parking downhill on a steep road, what does the road code suggest that you should do?

Answers.Answer: Leave your keys in the vehicle in case the brakes fail
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle away from the kerb and leave the vehicle in first gear
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle towards the kerb and leave the vehicle in reverse gear
Leave the wheels of your vehicle straight ahead and make sure that the handbrake is on

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?
At night, you MUST always dip the headlights on your vehicle when:
What does it mean if yellow traffic signals are flashing?

Answers.Answer: That a crash has just happened
The traffic signals are not working, apply the give way rules
Vehicles may only proceed straight ahead and not turn
Emergency vehicles are about to come through

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated

Question: Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer

Question: If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter
Signal only if there is a vehicle behind you and enter
Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: When driving on a road with lanes you must be able to stop in half the length of clear road you can see in front of you.
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 100km/h unless the road is clear
A rest area is 100 metres ahead

Question: Which of your vehicle’s lights do you have on if you are driving in fog?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You must check that there is space for your vehicle on the other side of the line before going over a railway level crossing.
What should you do when following another vehicle in wet conditions?

Answers.Answer: Drive closer to the vehicle so that you can follow in its tracks
Drive with your vehicle handbrake on

Question: You must NOT open the door of your motor vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are parked within 10 metres of a bus stop
you are likely to scratch the paint of your vehicle
the car radio in your vehicle is playing loud music
you are likely to hurt any person

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: What is the best way to check for hazards before reversing your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Relying only on the outside mirrors
Turning to look over your shoulders
Relying only on the inside mirrors
Walking around the vehicle before reversing

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp
